$$(751 - 745) + (748 - 742) + (745 - 739) + (742 - 736) + \cdots + (499 - 493) + (496 - 490).$$
The terms in the expression are
$$(751 - 745), (748 - 742), (745 - 739), (742 - 736), \dots, (499 - 493), (496 - 490).$$

We have $a_2 = 751 - 3(1) = 748$.
We have $a_3 = 751 - 3(2) = 745$.
The terms in the sequence are of the form $751 - 3n$, where $n=1,2,\dots$.
We want to find the value of $n$ for which $a_n = 496$.
We have $751 - 3n = 496$.
This implies $3n = 751 - 496 = 255$.
So $n = \frac{255}{3} = 85$.
Also, $496 - 490 = 6$.

The last term is $496 - 490$.
We want $751 - 3n = 496$. This gives $255 = 3n$, which means $n=85$.
We have 85 such terms. Each pair of terms sum to 6.
